acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data. As relevant information, a LD50 value of 49.9 mg/kg for mice (RTECS (2008)) and the details are unknown.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the classification of "Group 1" (there is sufficient evidence of carcinogenicity in humans) in IARC (IARC vol. 100A (2008), suppl. 7 (1987)) and "Known to be Human Carcinogens" in NTP (NTP RoC (2005)), the substance was classified into Category 1A.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: Classification is not possible since no data are available though the substance is possible to be classified into "Explosives" from which it contains chemical groups (N-N and N-O) associated with explosive properties present in the molecules and oxygen balance is -174.38 which is >-200.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on a positive result in a mouse micronucleus test (in vivo test) (RTECS (2008); Mutat. Res. 286 101-109 (1993)), the substance was classified into Category 2. As relevant information, there is a report of a positive unscheduled DNA synthesis test (RTECS (2008); Cancer Res 35, 2420-2425 (1975)). From in vitro mutagenicity tests, there is a report of a positive Ames test (RTECS (2008); Journal of the National Cancer Institute, vol. 65, p. 149).

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: May damage fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on a report of "fetal abnormalities if pregnancy occurs while taking this drug" as a common side effect (PDR 64 edition (2010)), the substance was classified into Category 1B.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid (melting point <= 140 degC) substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification is not possible since no data are available though there are chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification:
Category 1 (bone marrow),
Category 2 (liver, kidney, lung, nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement:
Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (bone marrow)
May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, kidney, lung, nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In Physicians' Desk Reference (PDR 64 edition (2010)), there are reports of nausea, vomiting, myelosuppression (decreased white blood cell count and platelet count) in the section on Common Side Effects. Based on the data, the substance was classified into Category 1 (bone marrow). In addition, there are reports of fatigue, sores in mouth or on lips, feeling disoriented, difficulty walking, blurred vision, change in vision, liver and kidney problems, and scarring of lung tissue in the section on Rare Side Effects. Since it is unclear whether they are secondary effects, the substance was classified into Category 2 (liver, kidney, lung, nervous system).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
Causes damage to organs (bone marrow)
May cause damage to organs (systemic toxicity)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In Physicians' Desk Reference (PDR 64 edition (2010)), there are reports of nausea, vomiting, myelosuppression (decreased white blood cell count and platelet count) in the section on Common Side Effects. Based on the data, the substance was classified into Category 1 (bone marrow). In addition, there are reports of fatigue, sores in mouth or on lips, feeling disoriented, difficulty walking, blurred vision, change in vision, liver and kidney problems, and scarring of lung tissue in the section on Rare Side Effects. Since it is unclear whether they are acute effects, the substance was classified into Category 2 (systemic toxicity).
